abstract: We take a step towards addressing the under足representation of the African continent in NLP research by creating the first large publicly available high quality dataset for named entity recognition (NER) in ten African languages, bringing together a variety of stakeholders. We detail characteristics of the languages to help researchers understand the challenges that these languages pose for NER. We analyze our datasets and conduct an extensive empirical evaluation of state足 of 足the 足art methods across both supervised and transfer learning settings. We release the data, code, and models in order to inspire future research on African NLP.
